job_title: Temporary Sales Associate Intern – Business Development – Kearny Mesa – Per Diem
description:
About the job
Hours

Shift Start Time

8 AM

Shift End Time

5 PM

Additional Shift Information

Weekend Requirements:

As Needed

On-Call Required

No

Hourly Pay Range (Minimum - Midpoint - Maximum)

$22.000 - $24.545 - $29.454

The stated pay scale reflects the range that Sharp reasonably expects to pay for this position.  The actual pay rate and pay grade for this position will be dependent on a variety of factors, including an applicant’s years of experience, unique skills and abilities, education, alignment with similar internal candidates, marketplace factors, other requirements for the position, and employer business practices.

Must be enrolled in an accredited 4 year college and have earned at least 31 college credits (reached sophomore standing) or must be a recent graduate (less than 12 months) from an accredited institution. Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above. You will be asked to please provide your college transcripts to Sharp Human Resources for verification.

This is a temporary internship position - 5 to 6 month internship. This is a per diem position located onsite in Kearny Mesa (San Diego County).

What You Will Do

Supports the business development department while enrolled in a business degree program or equivalent degree. Works in conjunction with sales and account management professionals as a part of the sales and marketing team; provides high quality, proactive customer service in a responsive, consistent manner to prospective and in-force Sharp Health Plan employer groups. Performs functions such as servicing accounts and resolving problems to maximize account executives' field time and enhance renewal probability of Sharp Health Plan clients.

Required Qualifications

Must be enrolled in an accredited four-year college program and have earned at least 31 college credits (reached sophomore standing) or must be a recent graduate (less than 12 months) from an accredited institution. Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above. You will be asked to please provide your college transcripts to Sharp Human Resources for verification.

Preferred Qualifications

1 Year experience in sales support in the health plan/insurance industry.

Essential Functions

Account retention/increased renewal membership Increase total SHP membership at renewal through successful proactive customer service.
Completes other duties as assigned Participates in special projects and other duties as assigned. These may include, but are not limited to, work groups, proposals, audits and back-up support for other departments.
Maintain marketing goals Achievement of SHP's Sales department's annual sales goals.
Office support Support of account executives Helps manage Individual Sales book of business, prospects and brokers in conjunction with Individual Sales team. Provides ongoing support to Sales staff. Fields phone calls and e-mails from customers and problem-solves to effectively resolve issues. Keeps logs of activity. Assists with open enrollment meetings and health fairs as necessary.
Provides internal and external customer service Provides prompt, accurate and excellent services to internal and external customers. Develops solid professional working relationships with various internal departments and units and, as required, vendors, providers, employers, brokers and/or other customers.

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Excellent problem solving (cause/effect) capabilities with experience in developing and executing task-oriented action plans.
Sound interpersonal skills which allows positive interaction with corporate customers, employee associations, and community brokers.
Basic computer literacy; i.e., MS Word, Excel, e-mail. Excellent time-management and prioritization skills.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment with continually shifting priorities.
The ability to work evenings and weekends as needed.

Sharp HealthCare is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability or any other protected class
title: cloud solutions intern

description:
About the job
Service Center

Fleet - Chicago

Job Summary

Responsible for preparing all assigned vehicles for the refinishing and reassembly processes and support Paint Technicians in paint jobs as required

Essential Job Duties
Complete all paint preparation processes for vehicles according to factory specification including the direction of the mentoring Paint Technician and by following the written repair order
Assist Paint Technician in pre-op by preparing spray-out panels to determine blend needs and assist in sanding and buffing to ensure the paint finish meets quality standards
Actively participate in morning board meetings by knowing the status of assigned vehicles and assisting in problem solving to keep all vehicles on schedule for on-time delivery
Consistently participate in monthly safety meetings and utilizes all required safety equipment and follow proper refinishing procedures in compliance with OSHA guidelines.
Adhere to all requirements for hazardous waste disposal
Follow vendor procedures to maintain all tools and equipment, including maintenance of paint booth and booth filters and maintains a clean and organized work space
Utilize air sanders, spray guns, sanding blocks, etc. in order to complete quality work
Review estimate to ensure all operations listed have been completed and verify the panel/parts to be painted
Clean, wax, polish and refurbish vehicles
Verify repaired areas are finished to Caliber standards
Identify all areas of the repair that may require additional corrosion protection (hidden welds, etc.)
Strict adherence to the “Principles of Downdraft Technology”
Insure that all paint operations are complete, all masking is removed, and all prior paint-related disassembly has been reassembled prior to returning the vehicle to the body technician
Compliance to all Caliber safety rules, guidelines and standards
Perform other related duties as assigned including, but not limited to washing cars, cleaning the shop, assisting other teammates, etc.
Skill/Requirements
Must be at least 18 years of age
HS diploma or GED. Auto Body Vo-Tech certificate strongly preferred
Ability to effectively communicate with others
Ability to read and understand basic instructions, written estimates and work orders
Multi-tasking; adapt easily to fast-paced environment
cal actions and functions for ~8 hours per day

title: cloud solutions intern

description:
About the job
Position Summary

The sales trainee will go through extensive training to become a representative that sells company products and services in an assigned territory within the continental United States. The 5-6 months training program will prepare this sales professional with thorough knowledge of the products and services offered to develop leads to create new customers and build business relationships with existing customers.

Must have a 4-year college degree.
Will report to Aurora, Indiana Campus, (Greater Cincinnati, Ohio area) for a 5-to-6-month in-person training program.
Training program is designed to develop subject matter experts in all product and service offerings with Matthews-Aurora Funeral Solutions.
Travel is required during training.
At completion of training candidate will relocate to any open sales position in the continental US.

Job Responsibilities

Compiles catalog of prospective customers for use as sales leads, based on information from newspapers, business directories, industry ads, trade shows, Internet Web sites, and other sources.
Travels throughout assigned territory to call on regular and prospective customers and pursue orders or talks with customers by phone.
Displays or demonstrates product, using samples or catalog, and emphasizes salable features and benefits.
Quotes prices and credit terms and prepares sales contracts for orders obtained. Provides credit applications and assists in collection of past due accounts.
Estimates date of delivery to customer, based on knowledge of production and delivery schedules.
Develops and maintains relationships with purchasing contacts.
Prepares reports of business transactions and maintains expense accounts.
Coordinates customer training.
Enters new customer data and sales data for current customers into computer database.
Investigates and resolves customer problems with deliveries.
Successfully and consistently achieves sales quotas.
Sells and promotes the Merchandising System and the accompanying products.
Instructs employees or purchasers in use of merchandising systems.
Attends state and regional trade shows.
Additional duties as assigned.

Qualifications / Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Sales, Engineering, or related field
Occasional travel either locally, nationally, and/or internationally may be required
High degree of proficiency in MS Office Suite, Outlook & Internet applications.
Strong analytical, prioritizing, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, budgeting, project management (from conception to completion), & planning skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning).
Solid understanding and application of mathematical concepts.
Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization, as well as, internal and external clients.
Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment.
Ability to work with and influence peers and management.
Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting.

PHYSICAL ASPECTS / WORK ENVIRONMENT

Regularly required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; and talk, hear and see.
Occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, moving mechanical parts, fumes or airborne particles, extreme cold & heat, risk of electrical shock, and toxic or caustic chemicals.
The noise level in the work environment is usually low/moderate.
